definition: Mahler (name)/Gustav Mahler (1860-1911), Austrian composer
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to strap tightly/to bind
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: The rider pulled his horsed up short.
sentences.chinese: 骑手突然一下把马勒住。

sentences.english: Its orchestration is similar to that of Mahler's.
sentences.chinese: 其编曲方式与马勒相似。

sentences.english: Vineyards are located in the cool pre-cordillera areas of Curico Valley and Maule Valley.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄园位于克里库山谷和马勒山谷较寒冷的山地。

sentences.english: 'Melissa Boyle Mahle,' she says, extending her hand.
sentences.chinese: “梅丽莎波义耳马勒，”她说，并且伸出手来握手。

sentences.english: All established manufacturers of combustion engines are customers of MAHLE.
sentences.chinese: 所有现有的内燃发动机制造商都是马勒的用户。

sentences.english: I would like to recognize Dr Mahler in the audience as one of my predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 我要承认在坐的马勒博士即是我的前辈之一。

sentences.english: Was Mahle's life really like that?
sentences.chinese: 马勒的生活真的就像那样吗？

sentences.english: Its richness of orchestration lies between Beethoven and Mahler.
sentences.chinese: 其丰富的管弦乐编曲横亘于贝多芬和马勒之间。

sentences.english: 'I was very impressed when I met Angelina,' says Mahle.
sentences.chinese: “当我遇见安吉丽娜时，非常惊讶，”马勒说。

sentences.english: What was this duple vision of Mahler's?
sentences.chinese: 还是回到“阴”与“阳”。马勒的双重影像是什么？

sentences.english: I am sure Dr Mahler would agree.
sentences.chinese: 我相信马勒博士会同意。

definition: Brahms (name)/Johannes Brahms (1833-1897), German romantic composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791), Austrian composer
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Tchaikovsky (1840-1893), Russian composer
Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827), German composer
Song of the Earth/Das Lied von der Erde
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
Handel (name)/Georg Frideric Händel (1785-), German composer
Claude Debussy (1862-1918), French composer
Schumann (name)/Robert Schumann (1810-1856), romantic composer
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750), German composer
